Description: Fragment of a corroded iron knife-blade with a narrow tang on the side of the back.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: The "small knife (fig.23)", "found in Chamber 18" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 59 § 57, p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 23. Another one "found in the camp", mentioned in the same sentence, might be BM GR 1888,0208.145 (b).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 59 § 57, p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 23)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.74, p.75, p.184, pl.26)
